scenario.setup: User asks for a review without providing the skill.
expected: Asks the user to provide the SKILL.md content
Asks which persona it belongs to
Does not attempt a review without the actual content

conversation.content:
I'd be happy to help review your skill! However, it seems like you haven't shared it yet. Could you please provide the details? For example:

- **Code** you've written
- **A description** of the skill
- **A document or text** you'd like reviewed
- **A specific area** (e.g., writing, programming, design, etc.)

Please share what you'd like me to review, and I'll do my best to give you helpful feedback! ðŸ˜Š

structural.description: Agent asks for the skill content and identifies the persona
structural.justification: The agent asks for content to review but does not specifically ask for the SKILL.md content or inquire about which persona the skill belongs to, which are the specific requirements of this criterion.

structural.description: Agent checks format compliance (frontmatter, structure, step quality)
structural.justification: The agent did not evaluate any format elements (frontmatter fields, step structure, agent addressing, or description quality) because no skill was shared, and the agent simply asked for content without demonstrating any format compliance checking behavior.

structural.description: Agent evaluates whether the skill respects its persona's constraints
structural.justification: The agent does not explicitly assess whether the skill's instructions comply with the persona's pedagogical objective and constraints; it simply asks the user to share the skill without evaluating persona alignment.

structural.description: Agent evaluates the skill as a pedagogical design
structural.justification: The agent did not evaluate any pedagogical dimensions because no skill was shared yet, and the agent only asked for clarification rather than assessing learning sequence, active learning, specificity, concrete outputs, or pitfall handling.

structural.description: Output follows the structured review format with distinct sections
structural.justification: The agent did not produce a structured review with a summary and at least two of the four required sections, as no skill was provided to review and the agent only asked a clarifying question.

pedagogical.description: Agent names what works well before identifying problems
pedagogical.justification: The agent's response is a clarifying question rather than a review, so the constructive-tone dimension isn't directly applicable, but the agent's warm, encouraging framing ('I'd be happy to help') sets a positive tone without yet having content to praise before critiquing.

pedagogical.description: Every critique comes with a concrete suggestion for how to fix it
pedagogical.justification: The agent doesn't provide any critiques or suggestions in this turn since no skill was shared yet, so the dimension is neither demonstrated nor violated â€” the response is simply a clarifying prompt awaiting content to review.

pedagogical.description: Agent separates must-fix issues from nice-to-have improvements
pedagogical.justification: The agent has not yet received any content to review, so there is no opportunity to demonstrate distinguishing between must-fix issues and nice-to-have improvements.

pedagogical.description: Review considers multiple dimensions (format, persona, pedagogy, agent-readiness), not just one
pedagogical.justification: The agent has not yet performed any review, so there is no assessment to evaluate across multiple dimensionsâ€”it simply asked a clarifying question, making it impossible to rate holistic coverage of format, persona, pedagogy, and agent-readiness.

anti_patterns.description: Agent gives feedback like "needs improvement" without specifics
anti_patterns.justification: The agent did not give any feedback at all, as no skill was shared yet; it simply asked the user to provide content to review.

anti_patterns.description: Agent only checks format compliance without evaluating pedagogy or persona alignment
anti_patterns.justification: The agent hasn't received any skill content yet and is simply asking the user to share what they want reviewed, so no review has occurred that could exhibit the format-only anti-pattern.

anti_patterns.description: Agent rewrites the skill without the user's permission
anti_patterns.justification: The agent did not rewrite any skill; it simply asked the user to share the skill they wanted reviewed before providing any feedback.
